document.docAuthor: Çiftçi, Derya, Růžička, Jan, Hasbenli, Abdullah & Şahin, Ülfet
document.masterDocTitle: The large carrion beetles (Coleoptera: Silphidae) of Turkey: a review with a new species record

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The large carrion beetles (Coleoptera: Silphidae) of Turkey: a review with a new species record

bibRefCitation.refString: Brulle, G. A. (1832) Expedition scientifique de Moree. Section des sciences physiques, Tome III. I er Partie. Zoologie. Deuxieme Section. Des animaux articules. F. G. Levrault, Paris, 288 pp. [Bory de Saint Vincent, J. B. G. M. (Ed.)]

subSubSection.paragraph:

Remarks. This subspecies is restricted to Bulgaria , Greece ,
Macedonia
, Romania and Turkey (Růžička 2015).
Tezcan et al . (2010)
treated
S. orientalis Brullé, 1832
as valid species and the synonym
S. multipunctata Frivaldszky von Frivald, 1845
as distinct taxa. Information on localities for these taxa is here listed under
S. obscura orientalis
. In Turkey ,
S. obscura orientalis
has mostly been recorded from the coastal regions of the Aegean and Marmara Regions ( Fig. 43 ). Here reported for the first time from Bolu , Çorum , Denizli , Edirne , Eskişehir , Isparta , Kars , Konya , Kütahya , Mersin , Muğla , Muş , Nevşehir and Tekirdağ Provinces.
